no legal force. Gen-
erally  it  is  not  the  role  of  courts  to  enact  laws,  but  the  courts  do  have  the
power to strike down laws if they conflict with provisions in our Constitution.
It is easy to imagine clear cases of laws that violate constitutional provi-
sions.  If  the  state  of  Kansas  began  printing  its  own  money,  that  would
plainly violate the constitutional provision that reserves this right to the fed-
eral government. But, typically, those constitutional questions
